content.question: If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>></mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E7A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all x, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>″</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo><</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E77@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all x, which of the following could be a table of values for f ?

choices.label: Table with two columns and four rows. The first title row is x and f(x). Second row is negative 1 and 4. Third row is 0 and 3. And fourth row is 1 and 1.
Table with two columns and four rows. The first title row is x and f(x). Second row is negative 1 and 4. Third row is 0 and 4. And fourth row is 1 and 4.
Table with two columns and four rows. The first title row is x and f(x). Second row is negative 1 and 4. Third row is 0 and 5. And fourth row is 1 and 6.
Table with two columns and four rows. The first title row is x and f(x). Second row is negative 1 and 4. Third row is 0 and 5. And fourth row is 1 and 7.
Table with two columns and four rows. The first title row is x and f(x). Second row is negative 1 and 4. Third row is 0 and 6. And fourth row is 1 and 7.

content.answer: Table with two columns and four rows. The first title row is x and f(x). Second row is negative 1 and 4. Third row is 0 and 6. And fourth row is 1 and 7.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
